## Cambios incompatibles hacia atrás

### PHP Core

#### String to Number Comparison

    Non-strict comparisons between numbers and non-numeric strings now work by casting the number to
    string and comparing the strings. Comparisons between numbers and numeric strings continue to
    work as before. Notably, this means that 0 == "not-a-number" is considered false
    now.






        Comparison
        Before
        After






        0 == "0"
        **[true](#constant.true)**
        **[true](#constant.true)**



        0 == "0.0"
        **[true](#constant.true)**
        **[true](#constant.true)**



        0 == "foo"
        **[true](#constant.true)**
        **[false](#constant.false)**



        0 == ""
        **[true](#constant.true)**
        **[false](#constant.false)**



        42 == "   42"
        **[true](#constant.true)**
        **[true](#constant.true)**



        42 == "42foo"
        **[true](#constant.true)**
        **[false](#constant.false)**





#### Other incompatible Changes

    -

      match is now a reserved keyword.





    -

      Assertion failures now throw by default. If the old behavior is desired,
      assert.exception=0 can be set in the INI settings.





    -

      Methods with the same name as the class are no longer interpreted as constructors. The
      [__construct()](#object.construct) method should be used instead.





    -

      The ability to call non-static methods statically has been removed. Thus
      [is_callable()](#function.is-callable) will fail when checking for a non-static method with a classname
      (must check with an object instance).





    -

      The (real) and (unset) casts have been removed.





    -

       The [track_errors](#ini.track-errors) ini directive has been removed. This
       means that php_errormsg is no longer available. The
       [error_get_last()](#function.error-get-last) function may be used instead.





    -

      The ability to define case-insensitive constants has been removed. The third argument to
      [define()](#function.define) may no longer be **[true](#constant.true)**.





    -

      The ability to specify an autoloader using an [__autoload()](#function.autoload) function has been
      removed. [spl_autoload_register()](#function.spl-autoload-register) should be used instead.





    -

      The errcontext argument will no longer be passed to custom error handlers
      set with [set_error_handler()](#function.set-error-handler).





    -

      [create_function()](#function.create-function) has been removed. Anonymous functions may be used instead.





    -

      [each()](#function.each) has been removed. [foreach](#control-structures.foreach) or [ArrayIterator](#class.arrayiterator)
      should be used instead.





    -

      The ability to unbind this from closures that were created from a method,
      using [Closure::fromCallable()](#closure.fromcallable) or
      [ReflectionMethod::getClosure()](#reflectionmethod.getclosure), has been removed.





    -

      The ability to unbind this from proper closures that contain uses of
      this has also been removed.





    -

      The ability to use [array_key_exists()](#function.array-key-exists) with objects has been removed.
      [isset()](#function.isset) or [property_exists()](#function.property-exists) may be used instead.





    -

      The behavior of [array_key_exists()](#function.array-key-exists) regarding the type of the
      key parameter has been made consistent with [isset()](#function.isset) and
      normal array access. All key types now use the usual coercions and array/object keys throw a
      [TypeError](#class.typeerror).





    -

      Any array that has a number n as its first numeric key will use
      n+1 for its next implicit key, even if n is
      negative.






    -

      The default error_reporting level is now **[E_ALL](#constant.e-all)**. Previously it excluded
      **[E_NOTICE](#constant.e-notice)** and **[E_DEPRECATED](#constant.e-deprecated)**.





    -

      [display_startup_errors](#ini.display-startup-errors) is now enabled by
      default.





    -

      Using parent inside a class that has no parent will now result in a fatal
      compile-time error.





    -

      The @ operator will no longer silence fatal errors
      (**[E_ERROR](#constant.e-error)**, **[E_CORE_ERROR](#constant.e-core-error)**,
      **[E_COMPILE_ERROR](#constant.e-compile-error)**, **[E_USER_ERROR](#constant.e-user-error)**,
      **[E_RECOVERABLE_ERROR](#constant.e-recoverable-error)**, **[E_PARSE](#constant.e-parse)**). Error handlers that
      expect error_reporting to be 0 when @ is used, should be
      adjusted to use a mask check instead:






&lt;?php
// Replace
function my_error_handler($err_no, $err_msg, $filename, $linenum) {
if (error_reporting() == 0) {
return; // Silenced
}
// ...
}

// With
function my_error_handler($err_no, $err_msg, $filename, $linenum) {
if (!(error_reporting() &amp; $err_no)) {
return; // Silenced
}
// ...
}
?&gt;

      Additionally, care should be taken that error messages are not displayed in production
      environments, which can result in information leaks. Please ensure that
      display_errors=Off is used in conjunction with error logging.





    -

      #[ is no longer interpreted as the start of a comment,
      as this syntax is now used for attributes.






    -

      Inheritance errors due to incompatible method signatures (LSP violations) will now always
      generate a fatal error. Previously a warning was generated in some cases.






    -

      The precedence of the concatenation operator has changed relative to bitshifts and addition as
      well as subtraction.






&lt;?php
echo "Sum: " . $a + $b;
// was previously interpreted as:
echo ("Sum: " . $a) + $b;
// is now interpreted as:
echo "Sum:" . ($a + $b);
?&gt;

    -

      Arguments with a default value that resolves to **[null](#constant.null)** at runtime will no longer implicitly mark
      the argument type as nullable. Either an explicit nullable type, or an explicit **[null](#constant.null)** default
      value has to be used instead.






&lt;?php
// Replace
function test(int $arg = CONST_RESOLVING_TO_NULL) {}
// With
function test(?int $arg = CONST_RESOLVING_TO_NULL) {}
// Or
function test(int $arg = null) {}
?&gt;

    -

      A number of warnings have been converted into [Error](#class.error) exceptions:







       <li>
        Attempting to write to a property of a non-object. Previously this
        implicitly created an stdClass object for null, false and empty strings.


       -
        Attempting to append an element to an array for which the PHP_INT_MAX key
        is already used.


       -
        Attempting to use an invalid type (array or object) as an array key or
        string offset.


       - Attempting to write to an array index of a scalar value.

       - Attempting to unpack a non-array/Traversable.

       -
        Attempting to access unqualified constants which are undefined.
        Previously, unqualified constant accesses resulted in a warning and were interpreted as strings.





      A number of notices have been converted into warnings:







       - Attempting to read an undefined variable.

       - Attempting to read an undefined property.

       - Attempting to read an undefined array key.

       - Attempting to read a property of a non-object.

       - Attempting to access an array index of a non-array.

       - Attempting to convert an array to string.

       - Attempting to use a resource as an array key.

       - Attempting to use null, a boolean, or a float as a string offset.

       - Attempting to read an out-of-bounds string offset.

       - Attempting to assign an empty string to a string offset.




    </li>
    -

      Attempting to assign multiple bytes to a string offset will now emit a warning.





    -

      Unexpected characters in source files (such as NUL bytes outside of strings) will now result in a
      [ParseError](#class.parseerror) exception instead of a compile warning.





    -

      Uncaught exceptions now go through "clean shutdown", which means that destructors will be called
      after an uncaught exception.





    -

      The compile time fatal error "Only variables can be passed by reference" has been delayed until
      runtime, and converted into an "Argument cannot be passed by reference"
      [Error](#class.error) exception.





    -

      Some "Only variables should be passed by reference" notices have been converted to "Argument
      cannot be passed by reference" exception.





    -

      The generated name for anonymous classes has changed. It will now include the name of the first
      parent or interface:






&lt;?php
new class extends ParentClass {};
// -&gt; ParentClass@anonymous
new class implements FirstInterface, SecondInterface {};
// -&gt; FirstInterface@anonymous
new class {};
// -&gt; class@anonymous
?&gt;

      The name shown above is still followed by a NUL byte and a unique suffix.





    -

      Non-absolute trait method references in trait alias adaptations are now required to be
      unambiguous:






&lt;?php
class X {
use T1, T2 {
func as otherFunc;
}
function func() {}
}
?&gt;

      If both T1::func() and T2::func() exist, this code was previously
      silently accepted, and func was assumed to refer to T1::func. Now it will generate a
      fatal error instead, and either T1::func or T2::func needs to be
      written explicitly.





    -

      The signature of abstract methods defined in traits is now checked against the implementing class
      method:






&lt;?php
trait MyTrait {
abstract private function neededByTrait(): string;
}

class MyClass {
use MyTrait;

    // Error, because of return type mismatch.
    private function neededByTrait(): int { return 42; }

}
?&gt;

    -

      Disabled functions are now treated exactly like non-existent functions. Calling a disabled
      function will report it as unknown, and redefining a disabled function is now possible.





    -

      data:// stream wrappers are no longer writable, which matches the documented
      behavior.





    -

      The arithmetic and bitwise operators +, -,
      *, /, **, %,
      &lt;&lt;, &gt;&gt;, &amp;,
      |, ^, ~, ++,
      -- will now consistently throw a [TypeError](#class.typeerror) when one of
      the operands is an [array](#language.types.array), [resource](#language.types.resource) or non-overloaded [object](#language.types.object). The only exception to this is
      the array + array merge operation, which remains supported.






    -

      Float to string casting will now always behave locale-independently.






&lt;?php
setlocale(LC_ALL, "de_DE");
$f = 3.14;
echo $f, "\n";
// Previously: 3,14
// Now: 3.14
?&gt;

      See [printf()](#function.printf), [number_format()](#function.number-format) and
      **NumberFormatter()** for ways to customize number formatting.






    -

      Support for deprecated curly braces for offset access has been removed.






&lt;?php
// Instead of:
$array{0};
$array{"key"};
// Write:
$array[0];
$array["key"];
?&gt;

    -

      Applying the final modifier on a private method will now produce a warning unless that method is
      the constructor.






    -

      If an object constructor [exit()](#function.exit)s, the object destructor will no longer be
      called. This matches the behavior when the constructor throws.





    -

      Namespaced names can no longer contain whitespace: While Foo\Bar will be recognized
      as a namespaced name, Foo \ Bar will not. Conversely, reserved keywords are now
      permitted as namespace segments, which may also change the interpretation of code:
      new\x is now the same as constant('new\x'), not
      new \x().






    -

      Nested ternaries now require explicit parentheses.






    -

      [debug_backtrace()](#function.debug-backtrace) and [Exception::getTrace()](#exception.gettrace) will no
      longer provide references to arguments. It will not be possible to change function arguments
      through the backtrace.





    -

      Numeric string handling has been altered to be more intuitive and less error-prone. Trailing
      whitespace is now allowed in numeric strings for consistency with how leading whitespace is
      treated. This mostly affects:







       <li>The [is_numeric()](#function.is-numeric) function

       - String-to-string comparisons

       - Type declarations

       - Increment and decrement operations




      The concept of a "leading-numeric string" has been mostly dropped; the cases where this remains
      exist in order to ease migration. Strings which emitted an **[E_NOTICE](#constant.e-notice)** "A non
      well-formed numeric value encountered" will now emit an **[E_WARNING](#constant.e-warning)** "A
      non-numeric value encountered" and all strings which emitted an **[E_WARNING](#constant.e-warning)** "A
      non-numeric value encountered" will now throw a
      [TypeError](#class.typeerror). This mostly affects:







       - Arithmetic operations

       - Bitwise operations




      This **[E_WARNING](#constant.e-warning)** to [TypeError](#class.typeerror) change also affects the
      **[E_WARNING](#constant.e-warning)** "Illegal string offset 'string'" for illegal string offsets. The
      behavior of explicit casts to int/float from strings has not been changed.




    </li>
    -

      Magic Methods will now have their arguments and return types checked if they have them declared.
      The signatures should match the following list:







       <li>__call(string $name, array $arguments): mixed

       - __callStatic(string $name, array $arguments): mixed

       - __clone(): void

       - __debugInfo(): ?array

       - __get(string $name): mixed

       - __invoke(mixed $arguments): mixed

       - __isset(string $name): bool

       - __serialize(): array

       - __set(string $name, mixed $value): void

       - __set_state(array $properties): object

       - __sleep(): array

       - __unserialize(array $data): void

       - __unset(string $name): void

       - __wakeup(): void




    </li>
    -

      [call_user_func_array()](#function.call-user-func-array) array keys will now be interpreted as parameter names,
      instead of being silently ignored.





    -

      Declaring a function called assert() inside a namespace is
      no longer allowed, and issues **[E_COMPILE_ERROR](#constant.e-compile-error)**.
      The [assert()](#function.assert) function is subject to special handling by the engine,
      which may lead to inconsistent behavior when defining a namespaced function with the same name.


### Resource to Object Migration

Several [resource](#language.types.resource)s have been migrated to [object](#language.types.object)s.
Return value checks using [is_resource()](#function.is-resource) should be replaced with checks for **[false](#constant.false)**.

    -

      [curl_init()](#function.curl-init) will now return a [CurlHandle](#class.curlhandle) object rather
      than a [resource](#language.types.resource). The [curl_close()](#function.curl-close) function no longer has an effect,
      instead the [CurlHandle](#class.curlhandle) instance is automatically destroyed if it is no
      longer referenced.





    -

      [curl_multi_init()](#function.curl-multi-init) will now return a [CurlMultiHandle](#class.curlmultihandle)
      object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource). The [curl_multi_close()](#function.curl-multi-close) function no
      longer has an effect, instead the [CurlMultiHandle](#class.curlmultihandle) instance is
      automatically destroyed if it is no longer referenced.





    -

      [curl_share_init()](#function.curl-share-init) will now return a [CurlShareHandle](#class.curlsharehandle)
      object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource). The [curl_share_close()](#function.curl-share-close) function no
      longer has an effect, instead the [CurlShareHandle](#class.curlsharehandle) instance is
      automatically destroyed if it is no longer referenced.


- [enchant_broker_init()](#function.enchant-broker-init) will now return an [EnchantBroker](#class.enchantbroker)
  object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

- [enchant_broker_request_dict()](#function.enchant-broker-request-dict) and
  [enchant_broker_request_pwl_dict()](#function.enchant-broker-request-pwl-dict) will now return an
  [EnchantDictionary](#class.enchantdictionary) object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

- The GD extension now uses [GdImage](#class.gdimage) objects as the underlying data structure
  for images, rather than [resource](#language.types.resource)s.
  The [imagedestroy()](#function.imagedestroy) function no longer has an effect; instead the
  [GdImage](#class.gdimage) instance is automatically destroyed if it is no longer referenced.

- [openssl_x509_read()](#function.openssl-x509-read) and [openssl_csr_sign()](#function.openssl-csr-sign) will now return
  an [OpenSSLCertificate](#class.opensslcertificate) object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).
  The [openssl_x509_free()](#function.openssl-x509-free) function is deprecated and no longer has an effect,
  instead the [OpenSSLCertificate](#class.opensslcertificate) instance is automatically destroyed if it
  is no longer referenced.

- [openssl_csr_new()](#function.openssl-csr-new) will now return an
  [OpenSSLCertificateSigningRequest](#class.opensslcertificatesigningrequest) object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

- [openssl_pkey_new()](#function.openssl-pkey-new) will now return an
  [OpenSSLAsymmetricKey](#class.opensslasymmetrickey) object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).
  The [openssl_pkey_free()](#function.openssl-pkey-free) function is deprecated and no longer has an effect,
  instead the [OpenSSLAsymmetricKey](#class.opensslasymmetrickey) instance is automatically destroyed if it
  is no longer referenced.

- [shmop_open()](#function.shmop-open) will now return a [Shmop](#class.shmop) object rather than
  a [resource](#language.types.resource). The [shmop_close()](#function.shmop-close) function no longer has an effect, and is
  deprecated; instead the [Shmop](#class.shmop) instance is automatically destroyed if it is
  no longer referenced.

- [socket_create()](#function.socket-create), [socket_create_listen()](#function.socket-create-listen),
  [socket_accept()](#function.socket-accept), [socket_import_stream()](#function.socket-import-stream),
  [socket_addrinfo_connect()](#function.socket-addrinfo-connect), [socket_addrinfo_bind()](#function.socket-addrinfo-bind), and
  [socket_wsaprotocol_info_import()](#function.socket-wsaprotocol-info-import) will now return a
  [Socket](#class.socket) object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).
  [socket_addrinfo_lookup()](#function.socket-addrinfo-lookup) will now return an array of
  [AddressInfo](#class.addressinfo) objects rather than [resource](#language.types.resource)s.

- [msg_get_queue()](#function.msg-get-queue) will now return an [SysvMessageQueue](#class.sysvmessagequeue)
  object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

- [sem_get()](#function.sem-get) will now return an [SysvSemaphore](#class.sysvsemaphore) object
  rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

- [shm_attach()](#function.shm-attach) will now return an [SysvSharedMemory](#class.sysvsharedmemory) object
  rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

- [xml_parser_create()](#function.xml-parser-create) and [xml_parser_create_ns()](#function.xml-parser-create-ns) will now
  return an [XMLParser](#class.xmlparser) object rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource). The
  [xml_parser_free()](#function.xml-parser-free) function no longer has an effect, instead the XMLParser
  instance is automatically destroyed if it is no longer referenced.

- The [XMLWriter](#book.xmlwriter) functions now accept and return, respectively,
  [XMLWriter](#class.xmlwriter) objects instead of [resource](#language.types.resource)s.

- [inflate_init()](#function.inflate-init) will now return an [InflateContext](#class.inflatecontext) object
  rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

- [deflate_init()](#function.deflate-init) will now return a [DeflateContext](#class.deflatecontext) object
  rather than a [resource](#language.types.resource).

### COM and .Net (Windows)

The ability to import case-insensitive constants from type libraries has been removed.
The second argument to [com_load_typelib()](#function.com-load-typelib) may no longer be false;
[com.autoregister_casesensitive](#ini.com.autoregister-casesensitive)
may no longer be disabled; case-insensitive markers in
[com.typelib_file](#ini.com.typelib-file) are ignored.

### CURL

**[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS](#constant.curlopt-postfields)** no longer accepts objects as arrays. To
interpret an object as an array, perform an explicit (array) cast. The
same applies to other options accepting arrays as well.

### Date and Time

[mktime()](#function.mktime) and [gmmktime()](#function.gmmktime) now require at least one
argument. [time()](#function.time) can be used to get the current timestamp.

### DOM

Unimplemented classes from the DOM extension that had no behavior and contained test
data have been removed. These classes have also been removed in the latest version of
the DOM standard:

    - DOMNameList

    - DomImplementationList

    - DOMConfiguration

    - DomError

    - DomErrorHandler

    - DOMImplementationSource

    - DOMLocator

    - DOMUserDataHandler

    - DOMTypeInfo

### Enchant

- [enchant_broker_list_dicts()](#function.enchant-broker-list-dicts), [enchant_broker_describe()](#function.enchant-broker-describe) and
  [enchant_dict_suggest()](#function.enchant-dict-suggest) will now return an empty array instead of **[null](#constant.null)**.

### Exif

[read_exif_data()](#function.read-exif-data) has been removed; [exif_read_data()](#function.exif-read-data)
should be used instead.

### Filter

- The **[FILTER_FLAG_SCHEME_REQUIRED](#constant.filter-flag-scheme-required)** and
  **[FILTER_FLAG_HOST_REQUIRED](#constant.filter-flag-host-required)** flags for the
  **[FILTER_VALIDATE_URL](#constant.filter-validate-url)** filter have been removed. The scheme
  and host are (and have been) always required.

- The **[INPUT_REQUEST](#constant.input-request)** and **[INPUT_SESSION](#constant.input-session)** source for
  [filter_input()](#function.filter-input) etc. have been removed. These were never implemented and their
  use always generated a warning.

### GD

- The deprecated functions [image2wbmp()](#function.image2wbmp) has been removed.

- The deprecated functions [png2wbmp()](#function.png2wbmp) and [jpeg2wbmp()](#function.jpeg2wbmp) have
  been removed.

- The default mode parameter of [imagecropauto()](#function.imagecropauto) no longer
  accepts -1. **[IMG_CROP_DEFAULT](#constant.img-crop-default)** should be used instead.

- On Windows, php_gd2.dll has been renamed to php_gd.dll.

### GMP

[gmp_random()](#function.gmp-random) has been removed. One of [gmp_random_range()](#function.gmp-random-range) or
[gmp_random_bits()](#function.gmp-random-bits) should be used instead.

### Iconv

iconv implementations which do not properly set errno in case of errors are no
longer supported.

### IMAP

- The unused default_host argument of [imap_headerinfo()](#function.imap-headerinfo)
  has been removed.

- The [imap_header()](#function.imap-header) function which is an alias of
  [imap_headerinfo()](#function.imap-headerinfo) has been removed.

### Internationalization Functions

- The deprecated constant **[INTL_IDNA_VARIANT_2003](#constant.intl-idna-variant-2003)** has been removed.

-


    The deprecated **[Normalizer::NONE](#normalizer.constants.none)** constant has been removed.

### LDAP

-


    The deprecated functions [ldap_sort()](#function.ldap-sort),
    [ldap_control_paged_result()](#function.ldap-control-paged-result) and
    [ldap_control_paged_result_response()](#function.ldap-control-paged-result-response) have been removed.

- The interface of [ldap_set_rebind_proc()](#function.ldap-set-rebind-proc) has changed; the
  callback parameter does not accept empty strings anymore; **[null](#constant.null)** should be
  used instead.

### MBString

- The [mbstring.func_overload](#ini.mbstring.func-overload) directive has been
  removed. The related **[MB_OVERLOAD_MAIL](#constant.mb-overload-mail)**,
  **[MB_OVERLOAD_STRING](#constant.mb-overload-string)**, and **[MB_OVERLOAD_REGEX](#constant.mb-overload-regex)** constants
  have also been removed. Finally, the "func_overload" and
  "func_overload_list" entries in [mb_get_info()](#function.mb-get-info) have been
  removed.

- [mb_parse_str()](#function.mb-parse-str) can no longer be used without specifying a result array.

- A number of deprecated mbregex aliases have been removed. See the following
  list for which functions should be used instead:

     <li>**mbregex_encoding()** → [mb_regex_encoding()](#function.mb-regex-encoding)
    - **mbereg()** → [mb_ereg()](#function.mb-ereg)

    - **mberegi()** → [mb_eregi()](#function.mb-eregi)

    - **mbereg_replace()** → [mb_ereg_replace()](#function.mb-ereg-replace)

    - **mberegi_replace()** → [mb_eregi_replace()](#function.mb-eregi-replace)

    - **mbsplit()** → [mb_split()](#function.mb-split)

    - **mbereg_match()** → [mb_ereg_match()](#function.mb-ereg-match)

    - **mbereg_search()** → [mb_ereg_search()](#function.mb-ereg-search)

    - **mbereg_search_pos()** → [mb_ereg_search_pos()](#function.mb-ereg-search-pos)

    - **mbereg_search_regs()** → [mb_ereg_search_regs()](#function.mb-ereg-search-regs)

    - **mbereg_search_init()** → [mb_ereg_search_init()](#function.mb-ereg-search-init)

    - **mbereg_search_getregs()** → [mb_ereg_search_getregs()](#function.mb-ereg-search-getregs)

    - **mbereg_search_getpos()** → [mb_ereg_search_getpos()](#function.mb-ereg-search-getpos)

    - **mbereg_search_setpos()** → [mb_ereg_search_setpos()](#function.mb-ereg-search-setpos)

   </li>
   - 
    
     The e modifier for [mb_ereg_replace()](#function.mb-ereg-replace) has been removed.
     [mb_ereg_replace_callback()](#function.mb-ereg-replace-callback) should be used instead.


- A non-string pattern argument to [mb_ereg_replace()](#function.mb-ereg-replace) will now be interpreted as
  a string instead of an ASCII codepoint. The previous behavior may be restored with an explicit
  call to [chr()](#function.chr).

- The needle argument for [mb_strpos()](#function.mb-strpos),
  [mb_strrpos()](#function.mb-strrpos), [mb_stripos()](#function.mb-stripos),
  [mb_strripos()](#function.mb-strripos), [mb_strstr()](#function.mb-strstr),
  [mb_stristr()](#function.mb-stristr), [mb_strrchr()](#function.mb-strrchr) and
  [mb_strrichr()](#function.mb-strrichr) can now be empty.

- The is_hex parameter, which was not used internally, has been removed from
  [mb_decode_numericentity()](#function.mb-decode-numericentity).

- The legacy behavior of passing the encoding as the third argument instead of an offset for the
  [mb_strrpos()](#function.mb-strrpos) function has been removed; an explicit 0
  offset with the encoding should be provided as the fourth argument instead.

- The ISO*8859-* character encoding aliases have been replaced by
  ISO8859-* aliases for better interoperability with the iconv extension. The
  mbregex ISO 8859 aliases with underscores (ISO_8859*_ and
  ISO8859\__) have also been removed.

- [mb_ereg()](#function.mb-ereg) and [mb_eregi()](#function.mb-eregi) will now return boolean **[true](#constant.true)** on
  a successful match. Previously they returned integer 1 if
  matches was not passed, or max(1, strlen($matches[0])) if
  matches was passed.

### OCI8

- The **OCI-Lob** class is now called [OCILob](#class.ocilob), and the
  **OCI-Collection** class is now called [OCICollection](#class.ocicollection)
  for name compliance enforced by PHP 8 arginfo type annotation tooling.

- Several alias functions have been marked as deprecated.

- [oci_internal_debug()](#function.oci-internal-debug) and its alias [ociinternaldebug()](#function.ociinternaldebug) have
  been removed.

### ODBC

- [odbc_connect()](#function.odbc-connect) no longer reuses connections.

- The unused flags parameter of [odbc_exec()](#function.odbc-exec) has been
  removed.

### OpenSSL

- [openssl_seal()](#function.openssl-seal) and [openssl_open()](#function.openssl-open) now require
  method to be passed, as the previous default of "RC4"
  is considered insecure.

### Regular Expressions (Perl-Compatible)

When passing invalid escape sequences they are no longer interpreted as literals. This behavior
previously required the X modifier – which is now ignored.

### PHP Data Objects

- The default error handling mode has been changed from "silent" to "exceptions". See
  [Errors and error handling](#pdo.error-handling) for details.

- The signatures of some PDO methods have changed:

     <li>PDO::query(string $query, ?int $fetchMode  = null, mixed  ...$fetchModeArgs)
    - PDOStatement::setFetchMode(int $mode, mixed ...$args)

   </li>
  


### PDO ODBC

The php.ini directive
[pdo_odbc.db2_instance_name](#ini.pdo-odbc.db2-instance-name) has been
removed.

### PDO MySQL

[PDO::inTransaction()](#pdo.intransaction) now reports the actual transaction state of
the connection, rather than an approximation maintained by PDO. If a query that is
subject to "implicit commit" is executed, [PDO::inTransaction()](#pdo.intransaction)
will subsequently return **[false](#constant.false)**, as a transaction is no longer active.

### PostgreSQL

- The deprecated [pg_connect()](#function.pg-connect) syntax using multiple parameters instead of a
  connection string is no longer supported.

- The deprecated [pg_lo_import()](#function.pg-lo-import) and [pg_lo_export()](#function.pg-lo-export) signature
  that passes the connection as the last argument is no longer supported. The connection should be
  passed as first argument instead.

- [pg_fetch_all()](#function.pg-fetch-all) will now return an empty array instead of **[false](#constant.false)** for result
  sets with zero rows.

### Phar

Metadata associated with a phar will no longer be automatically unserialized, to fix potential
security vulnerabilities due to object instantiation, autoloading, etc.

### Reflection

- The method signatures

     <li>ReflectionClass::newInstance($args)
    - ReflectionFunction::invoke($args)

    - ReflectionMethod::invoke($object, $args)

    have been changed to:
    - ReflectionClass::newInstance(...$args)

    - ReflectionFunction::invoke(...$args)

    - ReflectionMethod::invoke($object, ...$args)

    Code that must be compatible with both PHP 7 and PHP 8 can use the following
    signatures to be compatible with both versions:
    - ReflectionClass::newInstance($arg = null, ...$args)

    - ReflectionFunction::invoke($arg = null, ...$args)

    - ReflectionMethod::invoke($object, $arg = null, ...$args)

   </li>
   - 
    
     The [ReflectionType::__toString()](#reflectiontype.tostring) method will now return a complete debug
     representation of the type, and is no longer deprecated. In particular the result will include a
     nullability indicator for nullable types. The format of the return value is not stable and may
     change between PHP versions.


- Reflection export() methods have been removed.
  Instead reflection objects can be cast to string.

- [ReflectionMethod::isConstructor()](#reflectionmethod.isconstructor) and
  [ReflectionMethod::isDestructor()](#reflectionmethod.isdestructor) now also return **[true](#constant.true)** for
  [\_\_construct()](#object.construct) and
  [\_\_destruct()](#object.destruct) methods of interfaces.
  Previously, this would only be true for methods of classes and traits.

- **ReflectionType::isBuiltin()** method has been moved to
  [ReflectionNamedType](#class.reflectionnamedtype). [ReflectionUnionType](#class.reflectionuniontype) does not
  have it.

### Sockets

- The deprecated **[AI_IDN_ALLOW_UNASSIGNED](#constant.ai-idn-allow-unassigned)** and
  **[AI_IDN_USE_STD3_ASCII_RULES](#constant.ai-idn-use-std3-ascii-rules)** flags for
  [socket_addrinfo_lookup()](#function.socket-addrinfo-lookup) have been removed.

### Standard PHP Library (SPL)

- [SplFileObject::fgetss()](#splfileobject.fgetss) has been removed.

- [SplFileObject::seek()](#splfileobject.seek) now always seeks to the beginning of the line.
  Previously, positions =1 sought to the beginning of the next line.

- [SplHeap::compare()](#splheap.compare) now specifies a method signature. Inheriting classes
  implementing this method will now have to use a compatible method signature.

- [SplDoublyLinkedList::push()](#spldoublylinkedlist.push),
  [SplDoublyLinkedList::unshift()](#spldoublylinkedlist.unshift) and
  [SplQueue::enqueue()](#splqueue.enqueue) now return [void](language.types.void.html) instead of **[true](#constant.true)**.

- [spl_autoload_register()](#function.spl-autoload-register) will now always throw a
  [TypeError](#class.typeerror) on invalid arguments, therefore the second argument
  do_throw is ignored and a notice will be emitted if it is set to **[false](#constant.false)**.

- [SplFixedArray](#class.splfixedarray) is now an [IteratorAggregate](#class.iteratoraggregate)
  and not an [Iterator](#class.iterator).
  [SplFixedArray::rewind()](#splfixedarray.rewind), [SplFixedArray::current()](#splfixedarray.current),
  [SplFixedArray::key()](#splfixedarray.key), [SplFixedArray::next()](#splfixedarray.next), and
  [SplFixedArray::valid()](#splfixedarray.valid) have been removed. In their place,
  [SplFixedArray::getIterator()](#splfixedarray.getiterator) has been added. Any code which uses explicit
  iteration over SplFixedArray must now obtain an
  [Iterator](#class.iterator) through
  [SplFixedArray::getIterator()](#splfixedarray.getiterator). This means that
  [SplFixedArray](#class.splfixedarray) is now safe to use in nested loops.

### Standard Library

- [assert()](#function.assert) will no longer evaluate string arguments, instead they will be
  treated like any other argument. assert($a == $b) should be used instead of
     assert('$a == $b'). The [assert.quiet_eval](#ini.assert.quiet-eval) ini directive and the
  **[ASSERT_QUIET_EVAL](#constant.assert-quiet-eval)** constant have also been removed, as they would no longer
  have any effect.

- [parse_str()](#function.parse-str) can no longer be used without specifying a result array.

- The [string.strip_tags](#filters.string.strip_tags) filter has been removed.

- The needle argument of [strpos()](#function.strpos),
  [strrpos()](#function.strrpos), [stripos()](#function.stripos), [strripos()](#function.strripos),
  [strstr()](#function.strstr), [strchr()](#function.strchr), [strrchr()](#function.strrchr), and
  [stristr()](#function.stristr) will now always be interpreted as a string. Previously non-string
  needles were interpreted as an ASCII code point. An explicit call to [chr()](#function.chr) can
  be used to restore the previous behavior.

- The needle argument for [strpos()](#function.strpos),
  [strrpos()](#function.strrpos), [stripos()](#function.stripos), [strripos()](#function.strripos),
  [strstr()](#function.strstr), [stristr()](#function.stristr) and [strrchr()](#function.strrchr) can
  now be empty.

- The length argument for [substr()](#function.substr),
  [substr_count()](#function.substr-count), [substr_compare()](#function.substr-compare), and
  [iconv_substr()](#function.iconv-substr) can now be **[null](#constant.null)**. **[null](#constant.null)** values will behave as if no length
  argument was provided and will therefore return the remainder of the string instead of an empty
  string.

- The length argument for [array_splice()](#function.array-splice) can now be
  **[null](#constant.null)**. **[null](#constant.null)** values will behave identically to omitting the argument, thus removing everything
  from the offset to the end of the array.

- The args argument of [vsprintf()](#function.vsprintf),
  [vfprintf()](#function.vfprintf), and [vprintf()](#function.vprintf) must now be an array. Previously
  any type was accepted.

- The 'salt' option of [password_hash()](#function.password-hash) is no longer
  supported. If the 'salt' option is used a warning is generated, the provided
  salt is ignored, and a generated salt is used instead.

- The [quotemeta()](#function.quotemeta) function will now return an empty string if an empty string
  was passed. Previously **[false](#constant.false)** was returned.

- The following functions have been removed:

     <li>[hebrevc()](#function.hebrevc)
    - [convert_cyr_string()](#function.convert-cyr-string)

    - [money_format()](#function.money-format)

    - [ezmlm_hash()](#function.ezmlm-hash)

    - [restore_include_path()](#function.restore-include-path)

    - [get_magic_quotes_gpc()](#function.get-magic-quotes-gpc)

    - [get_magic_quotes_runtime()](#function.get-magic-quotes-runtime)

    - [fgetss()](#function.fgetss)

   </li>
   - 
    
     **[FILTER_SANITIZE_MAGIC_QUOTES](#constant.filter-sanitize-magic-quotes)** has been removed.


- Calling [implode()](#function.implode) with parameters in a reverse order ($pieces,
     $glue) is no longer supported.

- [parse_url()](#function.parse-url) will now distinguish absent and empty queries and fragments:

     <li>http://example.com/foo → query = null, fragment = null
    - http://example.com/foo? → query = "", fragment = null

    - http://example.com/foo# → query = null, fragment = ""

    - http://example.com/foo?# → query = "", fragment = ""

    Previously all cases resulted in query and fragment being **[null](#constant.null)**.

   </li>
   - 
    
     [var_dump()](#function.var-dump) and [debug_zval_dump()](#function.debug-zval-dump) will now print
     floating-point numbers using [serialize_precision](#ini.serialize-precision)
     rather than [precision](#ini.precision). In a default configuration, this
     means that floating-point numbers are now printed with full accuracy by these debugging
     functions.


- If the array returned by [\_\_sleep()](#object.sleep) contains non-existing
  properties, these are now silently ignored. Previously, such properties would have been
  serialized as if they had the value **[null](#constant.null)**.

- The default locale on startup is now always "C". No locales are inherited from
  the environment by default. Previously, **[LC_ALL](#constant.lc-all)** was set to
  "C", while **[LC_CTYPE](#constant.lc-ctype)** was inherited from the environment.
  However, some functions did not respect the inherited locale without an explicit
  [setlocale()](#function.setlocale) call. An explicit [setlocale()](#function.setlocale) call is now
  always required if a locale component should be changed from the default.

- The deprecated DES fallback in [crypt()](#function.crypt) has been removed. If an unknown salt
  format is passed to [crypt()](#function.crypt), the function will fail with \*0
  instead of falling back to a weak DES hash now.

- Specifying out of range rounds for SHA256/SHA512 [crypt()](#function.crypt) will now fail with
  \*0 instead of clamping to the closest limit. This matches glibc behavior.

- The result of sorting functions may have changed, if the array contains elements that compare as
  equal.

- Any functions accepting callbacks that are not explicitly specified to accept parameters by
  reference will now warn if a callback with reference parameters is used. Examples include
  [array_filter()](#function.array-filter) and [array_reduce()](#function.array-reduce). This was already the
  case for most, but not all, functions previously.

- The HTTP stream wrapper as used by functions like [file_get_contents()](#function.file-get-contents)
  now advertises HTTP/1.1 rather than HTTP/1.0 by default. This does not change the behavior of the
  client, but may cause servers to respond differently. To retain the old behavior, set the
  'protocol_version' stream context option, e.g.

&lt;?php
$ctx = stream_context_create(['http' =&gt; ['protocol_version' =&gt; '1.0']]);
echo file_get_contents('http://example.org', false, $ctx);
?&gt;

- Calling [crypt()](#function.crypt) without an explicit salt is no longer supported. If you would
  like to produce a strong hash with an auto-generated salt, use
  [password_hash()](#function.password-hash) instead.

-


    [substr()](#function.substr), [mb_substr()](#function.mb-substr), [iconv_substr()](#function.iconv-substr) and
    [grapheme_substr()](#function.grapheme-substr) now consistently clamp out-of-bounds offsets to the string
    boundary. Previously, **[false](#constant.false)** was returned instead of the empty string in some cases.

- On Windows, the program execution functions ([proc_open()](#function.proc-open), [exec()](#function.exec),
  [popen()](#function.popen) etc.) using the shell, now consistently execute **%comspec% /s
  /c "$commandline"**, which has the same effect as executing
  **$commandline** (without additional quotes).

### Sysvsem

- The auto_release parameter of [sem_get()](#function.sem-get) was changed to
  accept bool values rather than int.

### Tidy

- The use_include_path parameter, which was not used internally, has been
  removed from [tidy_repair_string()](#tidy.repairstring).

- [tidy::repairString()](#tidy.repairstring) and [tidy::repairFile()](#tidy.repairfile) became
  static methods.

### Tokenizer

- T_COMMENT tokens will no longer include a trailing newline. The newline will
  instead be part of a following T_WHITESPACE token. It should be noted that
  T_COMMENT is not always followed by whitespace, it may also be followed by
  T_CLOSE_TAG or end-of-file.

- Namespaced names are now represented using the T_NAME_QUALIFIED
  (Foo\Bar), T_NAME_FULLY_QUALIFIED (\Foo\Bar) and
  T_NAME_RELATIVE (namespace\Foo\Bar) tokens.
  T_NS_SEPARATOR is only used for standalone namespace separators, and only
  syntactially valid in conjunction with group use declarations.

### XMLReader

[XMLReader::open()](#xmlreader.open) and [XMLReader::xml()](#xmlreader.xml) are now
static methods. They can still be called as instance methods, but inheriting classes need to declare them
as static if they override these methods.

### XML-RPC

The XML-RPC extension has been moved to PECL and is no longer part of the PHP
distribution.

### Zip

**[ZipArchive::OPSYS_Z_CPM](#ziparchive.constants.opsys-z-cpm)** has been removed (this name was a typo). Use
**[ZipArchive::OPSYS_CPM](#ziparchive.constants.opsys-cpm)** instead.

### Zlib

- [gzgetss()](#function.gzgetss) has been removed.

- [zlib.output_compression](#ini.zlib.output-compression) is no longer
  automatically disabled for Content-Type: image/\*.

### Windows PHP Test Packs

The test runner has been renamed from run-test.php to
run-tests.php, to match its name in php-src.

## Funcionalidades obsoletas

### Núcleo PHP

- If a parameter with a default value is followed by a required parameter, the default value has
  no effect. This is deprecated as of PHP 8.0.0 and can generally be resolved by dropping the
  default value, without a change in functionality:

&lt;?php
function test($a = [], $b) {} // Before
function test($a, $b) {} // After
?&gt;

     One exception to this rule are parameters of the form Type $param = null, where
     the null default makes the type implicitly nullable. This usage remains allowed, but it is
     recommended to use an explicit nullable type instead:






&lt;?php
function test(A $a = null, $b) {} // Still allowed
function test(?A $a, $b) {} // Recommended
?&gt;

- Calling [get_defined_functions()](#function.get-defined-functions) with exclude_disabled
  explicitly set to **[false](#constant.false)** is deprecated and no longer has an effect.
  [get_defined_functions()](#function.get-defined-functions) will never include disabled functions.

### Enchant

- [enchant_broker_set_dict_path()](#function.enchant-broker-set-dict-path) and
  [enchant_broker_get_dict_path()](#function.enchant-broker-get-dict-path)
  are deprecated, because that functionality is neither available in libenchant &lt; 1.5 nor in
  libenchant-2.

- [enchant_dict_add_to_personal()](#function.enchant-dict-add-to-personal) is deprecated; use
  [enchant_dict_add()](#function.enchant-dict-add) instead.

- [enchant_dict_is_in_session()](#function.enchant-dict-is-in-session) is deprecated; use
  [enchant_dict_is_added()](#function.enchant-dict-is-added) instead.

- [enchant_broker_free()](#function.enchant-broker-free) and [enchant_broker_free_dict()](#function.enchant-broker-free-dict) are
  deprecated; unset the object instead.

- The **[ENCHANT_MYSPELL](#constant.enchant-myspell)** and **[ENCHANT_ISPELL](#constant.enchant-ispell)** constants are
  deprecated.

### LibXML

[libxml_disable_entity_loader()](#function.libxml-disable-entity-loader) has been deprecated. As libxml 2.9.0 is now
required, external entity loading is guaranteed to be disabled by default, and this function is
no longer needed to protect against XXE attacks.

### PGSQL / PDO PGSQL

- The constant **[PGSQL_LIBPQ_VERSION_STR](#constant.pgsql-libpq-version-str)** now has the same value as
  **[PGSQL_LIBPQ_VERSION](#constant.pgsql-libpq-version)**, and thus is deprecated.

- Function aliases in the pgsql extension have been deprecated.
  See the following list for which functions should be used instead:

     <li>**pg_errormessage()** → [pg_last_error()](#function.pg-last-error)
    - **pg_numrows()** → [pg_num_rows()](#function.pg-num-rows)

    - **pg_numfields()** → [pg_num_fields()](#function.pg-num-fields)

    - **pg_cmdtuples()** → [pg_affected_rows()](#function.pg-affected-rows)

    - **pg_fieldname()** → [pg_field_name()](#function.pg-field-name)

    - **pg_fieldsize()** → [pg_field_size()](#function.pg-field-size)

    - **pg_fieldtype()** → [pg_field_type()](#function.pg-field-type)

    - **pg_fieldnum()** → [pg_field_num()](#function.pg-field-num)

    - **pg_result()** → [pg_fetch_result()](#function.pg-fetch-result)

    - **pg_fieldprtlen()** → [pg_field_prtlen()](#function.pg-field-prtlen)

    - **pg_fieldisnull()** → [pg_field_is_null()](#function.pg-field-is-null)

    - **pg_freeresult()** → [pg_free_result()](#function.pg-free-result)

    - **pg_getlastoid()** → [pg_last_oid()](#function.pg-last-oid)

    - **pg_locreate()** → [pg_lo_create()](#function.pg-lo-create)

    - **pg_lounlink()** → [pg_lo_unlink()](#function.pg-lo-unlink)

    - **pg_loopen()** → [pg_lo_open()](#function.pg-lo-open)

    - **pg_loclose()** → [pg_lo_close()](#function.pg-lo-close)

    - **pg_loread()** → [pg_lo_read()](#function.pg-lo-read)

    - **pg_lowrite()** → [pg_lo_write()](#function.pg-lo-write)

    - **pg_loreadall()** → [pg_lo_read_all()](#function.pg-lo-read-all)

    - **pg_loimport()** → [pg_lo_import()](#function.pg-lo-import)

    - **pg_loexport()** → [pg_lo_export()](#function.pg-lo-export)

    - **pg_setclientencoding()** → [pg_set_client_encoding()](#function.pg-set-client-encoding)

    - **pg_clientencoding()** -&gt; [pg_client_encoding()](#function.pg-client-encoding)

   </li>
  


### Standard Library

- Sort comparison functions that return **[true](#constant.true)** or **[false](#constant.false)** will now throw a deprecation warning, and
  should be replaced with an implementation that returns an integer less than, equal to, or greater
  than zero.

&lt;?php
// Replace
usort($array, fn($a, $b) =&gt; $a &gt; $b);
// With
usort($array, fn($a, $b) =&gt; $a &lt;=&gt; $b);
?&gt;

### Zip

- Using an empty file as ZipArchive is deprecated. Libzip 1.6.0 does not accept empty files as
  valid zip archives any longer. The existing workaround will be removed in the next version.

- The procedural API of Zip is deprecated. Use [ZipArchive](#class.ziparchive) instead.
  Iteration over all entries can be accomplished using [ZipArchive::statIndex()](#ziparchive.statindex)
  and a [for](#control-structures.for) loop:

&lt;?php
// iterate using the procedural API
assert(is_resource($zip));
while ($entry = zip_read($zip)) {
    echo zip_entry_name($entry);
}

// iterate using the object-oriented API
assert($zip instanceof ZipArchive);
for ($i = 0; $entry = $zip-&gt;statIndex($i); $i++) {
echo $entry['name'];
}
?&gt;

### Reflection

- [ReflectionFunction::isDisabled()](#reflectionfunction.isdisabled) is deprecated, as it is no longer
  possible to create a [ReflectionFunction](#class.reflectionfunction) for a disabled function. This
  method now always returns **[false](#constant.false)**.

- [ReflectionParameter::getClass()](#reflectionparameter.getclass),
  [ReflectionParameter::isArray()](#reflectionparameter.isarray), and
  [ReflectionParameter::isCallable()](#reflectionparameter.iscallable) are deprecated.
  [ReflectionParameter::getType()](#reflectionparameter.gettype) and the
  [ReflectionType](#class.reflectiontype) APIs should be used instead.

### Cambios en los módulos SAPI

#### Apache2Handler

    El módulo PHP ha sido renombrado de php7_module a
    php_module.

### Fucniones Cambiadas

#### Reflection

    Los resultados de [ReflectionClass::getConstants()](#reflectionclass.getconstants) y
    [ReflectionClass::getReflectionConstants()](#reflectionclass.getreflectionconstants) pueden ser filtrados a través de un nuevo parámetro
    filter. Tres nuevas constantes han sido añadidas para ser usadas junto a la clase:







     - **[ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PUBLIC](#reflectionclassconstant.constants.is-public)**

     - **[ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PROTECTED](#reflectionclassconstant.constants.is-protected)**

     - **[ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PRIVATE](#reflectionclassconstant.constants.is-private)**

#### Zip

    -

      Los métodos [ZipArchive::addGlob()](#ziparchive.addglob) y
      [ZipArchive::addPattern()](#ziparchive.addpattern) aceptan más valores en el
      options argumento de array:







       <li>flags

       - comp_method

       - comp_flags

       - env_method

       - enc_password



    </li>
    -

      [ZipArchive::addEmptyDir()](#ziparchive.addemptydir), [ZipArchive::addFile()](#ziparchive.addfile)
      and [ZipArchive::addFromString()](#ziparchive.addfromstring)
      methods have a new flags argument. This allows managing name encoding
      (**[ZipArchive::FL_ENC_*](#ziparchive.constants.fl-enc-*)**) and entry replacement
      (**[ZipArchive::FL_OVERWRITE](#ziparchive.constants.fl-overwrite)**).





    -

      [ZipArchive::extractTo()](#ziparchive.extractto) ahora restaura el tiempo de modificación del archivo.


### Otros cambios a las extensiones

#### CURL

    -

      La extensión CURL ahora requiere al menos libcurl 7.29.0.





    -

      El parámetro obsoleto version de [curl_version()](#function.curl-version) ha
      sido eliminado.


#### Fecha y Tiempo

    [DatePeriod](#class.dateperiod) ahora implementa [IteratorAggregate](#class.iteratoraggregate)
    (instead of [Traversable](#class.traversable)).

#### DOM

    [DOMNamedNodeMap](#class.domnamednodemap) y [DOMNodeList](#class.domnodelist) ahora implementan
    [IteratorAggregate](#class.iteratoraggregate) (instead of
    [Traversable](#class.traversable)).

#### Intl

    [IntlBreakIterator](#class.intlbreakiterator) y [ResourceBundle](#class.resourcebundle) ahora implementan
    [IteratorAggregate](#class.iteratoraggregate) (instead of [Traversable](#class.traversable)).

#### Enchant

    La extensión enchant ahora usa libenchant-2 por defecto cuando esté disponible. libenchant versión 1 sigue
    siendo soportado pero está obsoleto y podría ser borrado en el futuro.

#### GD

    -

      El num_points párametro de [imagepolygon()](#function.imagepolygon),
      [imageopenpolygon()](#function.imageopenpolygon) y [imagefilledpolygon()](#function.imagefilledpolygon) es ahora
      opcional, p.e. esas funciones pueden ser llamadas con 3 o 4 argumentos. Si el argumento está
      omitido, está calculado como count($points)/2.





    -

      La función [imagegetinterpolation()](#function.imagegetinterpolation) para obtener la interpolación actual
      ha sido añadida.


#### JSON

    La extensión JSON no puede ser deshabilitada y siempre será una parte integral de cualquier build PHP.
    De manera similar a la extensión de fecha.

#### MBString

    La tabla unicode ha sido actualizada a la versión 13.0.0.

#### PDO

    [PDOStatement](#class.pdostatement) ahora implementa
    [IteratorAggregate](#class.iteratoraggregate) (instead of
    [Traversable](#class.traversable)).

#### LibXML

    La versión mínima requerida es 2.9.0. Esto significa que la carga externa está garantizada de ser deshabilitada
    por defecto y no habrá pasos extras para protegerse frente a los ataques XXE

#### MySQLi / PDO MySQL

    -

      Cuando mysqlnd no sea usado (que es la opción recomendada y por defecto),
      la versión libmysqlclient mínima soportada es ahora 5.5.





    -

      [mysqli_result](#class.mysqli-result) ahora implementa
      [IteratorAggregate](#class.iteratoraggregate) (instead of
      [Traversable](#class.traversable)).


#### PGSQL / PDO PGSQL

    Las extensiones PGQSQL y PDO PGSQL ahora requieren al menos libpq 9.1.

#### Readline

    Llamar a [readline_completion_function()](#function.readline-completion-function) antes de que un prompt interactivo comience
    (e.g. in [auto_prepend_file](#ini.auto-prepend-file)) ahora sobreescribirá
    default interactive prompt completion function. Previamente
    [readline_completion_function()](#function.readline-completion-function) solo trabajaba cuando se le llamaba antes de comenzar el
    prompt interactivo.

#### SimpleXML

    [SimpleXMLElement](#class.simplexmlelement) ahora implementa
    [RecursiveIterator](#class.recursiveiterator) y absorve la funcionalidad de
    [SimpleXMLIterator](#class.simplexmliterator). [SimpleXMLIterator](#class.simplexmliterator) es una extensión vacía de
    [SimpleXMLElement](#class.simplexmlelement).

### Cambios al INI File Handling

- com.dotnet_version
  es una nueva directiva INI para elegir la versión del framework .NET a usar en los objetos
  [dotnet](#class.dotnet) .

- zend.exception_string_param_max_len
  es una nueva directiva INI para establecer la longitud máxima del string de una stringified
  stack strace.

### EBCDIC

Los objetivos EBCDIC no estarán más soportadas, aunque es poco probable que todavía estuvieran trabajando en el
primer lugar.

### Rendimiento

- Un compilador Just-In-Time (JIT) ha sido añadido a la extensión opcache

- [array_slice()](#function.array-slice) de un array sin gaps no escaneará más el array completo
  para encontrar el offset del comienzo. Esto puede ser significante al reducir el runtime de la función con offsets más largos y
  tamaños más pequeños.

- [strtolower()](#function.strtolower) ahora usa una implementación SIMD cuando se usa
  "C" **[LC_CTYPE](#constant.lc-ctype)** locale (que es la opción por defecto).

# Migración de PHP 7.3.x a PHP 7.4.x

## Tabla de contenidos

- [Nuevas características](#migration74.new-features)
- [Nuevas clases e interfaces](#migration74.new-classes)
- [Nuevas funciones](#migration74.new-functions)
- [Nuevas constantes globales](#migration74.constants)
- [Cambios incompatibles con versiones anteriores](#migration74.incompatible)
- [Funcionalidades obsoletas](#migration74.deprecated)
- [Extensiones eliminadas](#migration74.removed-extensions)
- [Otros cambios](#migration74.other-changes)
- [Soporte para Windows](#migration74.windows-support)

    Esta nueva versión menor trae consigo una serie de
    [nuevas características](#migration74.new-features) y
    [algunas incompatibilidades](#migration74.incompatible)
    que debe ser probado antes de cambiar las versiones de PHP en los entornos de producción.

    Véase también las guías de migración entre las diferentes versiones de PHP
    [7.0.x](#migration70),
    [7.1.x](#migration71),
    [7.2.x](#migration72) y
    [7.3.x](#migration73).

## Nuevas características

### Núcleo de PHP

#### Propiedades tipadas

    Las propiedades de las clases ahora soportan la declaración de tipos.





&lt;?php
class User {
public int $id;
public string $name;
}
?&gt;

    El ejemplo anterior asegura que $user-&gt;id solo puede
    recibir valores de tipo [int](#language.types.integer) y
    $user-&gt;name solo puede recibir valores de tipo
    [string](#language.types.string).

#### Funciones flecha

    Las [funciones flecha](#functions.arrow) proporcionan
    una sintaxis corta para definir funciones que enlazan el ámbito por valor de manera implícita.






&lt;?php
$factor = 10;
$nums = array_map(fn($n) =&gt; $n \* $factor, [1, 2, 3, 4]);
// $nums = array(10, 20, 30, 40);
?&gt;

#### Tipo de retorno covariante y tipo de argumento contravariante limitado

    El siguiente código ahora funcionará:





&lt;?php
class A {}
class B extends A {}

class Producer {
public function method(): A {}
}
class ChildProducer extends Producer {
public function method(): B {}
}
?&gt;

    El soporte de varianza total solo está disponible cuando se utiliza la carga automática. En un único fichero solo son posibles referencias de tipos no cíclicos, ya que todas las clases deben estar disponibles antes de ser referenciadas.



&lt;?php

/\*\*

- Estas clases satisfacen los requisitos del LSP, ya que C es un subtipo de A.
- Sin embargo, en el momento en que se declara la clase B, la clase C aún no está disponible
  \*/
  class A
  {
  public function method(): A {}
  }

class B extends A
{
// Error fatal: No se puede verificar la compatibilidad entre B::method():C y
// A::method(): A, ya que la clase C no está disponible
public function method(): С {}
}

class C extends B {}

?&gt;

#### Operador de asignación de fusión Null

&lt;?php
$array['key'] ??= computeDefault();
// es aproximadamente equivalente a
if (!isset($array['key'])) {
$array['key'] = computeDefault();
}
?&gt;

#### Desempaquetado en los arrays

&lt;?php
$parts = ['apple', 'pear'];
$fruits = ['banana', 'orange', ...$parts, 'watermelon'];
// ['banana', 'orange', 'apple', 'pear', 'watermelon'];
?&gt;

#### Separador numérico literal

    Los números literales pueden contener un carácter de subrayado entre
    los dígitos.





&lt;?php
6.674_083e-11; // float
299_792_458; // decimal
0xCAFE_F00D; // hexadecimal
0b0101_1111; // binario
?&gt;

#### Referencias débiles

    Las [referencias débiles](#class.weakreference) permiten al desarrollador retener una referencia
    a un objeto que no impide que el objeto sea destruido.

#### Permitir Excepciones desde \_\_toString()

    Lanzar excepciones desde [__toString()](#object.tostring)
    ahora está permitido. Anteriormente, esto resultaba en un error fatal.
    Los errores fatales recuperables en las conversiones de [string](#language.types.string) han sido
    convertidos en excepciones [Error](#class.error).

### CURL

[CURLFile](#class.curlfile) ahora soporta las envolturas de flujo
además de los nombres de ficheros brutos, si la extensión ha sido compilada con libcurl
&gt;= 7.56.0.

### Filtro

El filtro **[FILTER_VALIDATE_FLOAT](#constant.filter-validate-float)** ahora soporta las
opciones min_range y max_range,
con la misma sémantica que **[FILTER_VALIDATE_INT](#constant.filter-validate-int)**.

### FFI

FFI es una nueva extensión, que proporciona una manera sencilla de llamar
a las funciones nativas, acceso nativo a las variables, y la creación/acceso a
estructuras de datos definidas en bibliotecas C.

### GD

Se ha añadido el filtro de imagen **[IMG_FILTER_SCATTER](#constant.img-filter-scatter)**
para aplicar un filtro de dispersión a las imágenes.

### Hash

Se ha añadido el hash crc32c utilizando el polinomio de Castagnoli.
Esta variante de CRC32 es utilizada por sistemas de almacenamiento, tales como
iSCSI, SCTP, Btrfs y ext4.

### Cadenas multioctetos

Se ha añadido la función [mb_str_split()](#function.mb-str-split), que proporciona la misma
funcionalidad que [str_split()](#function.str-split), pero opera sobre puntos de código en lugar de octetos.

### OPcache

[El soporte para la precarga de código](#opcache.preloading) ha sido añadido.

### Expresiones Regulares (Compatible Perl)

Las funciones [preg_replace_callback()](#function.preg-replace-callback) y
[preg_replace_callback_array()](#function.preg-replace-callback-array) ahora aceptan un
argumento flags adicional, con soporte para los
flags **[PREG_OFFSET_CAPTURE](#constant.preg-offset-capture)** y
**[PREG_UNMATCHED_AS_NULL](#constant.preg-unmatched-as-null)**.
Esto influye en el formato del [array](#language.types.array) de coincidencias pasado a la función de retrollamada.

### PDO

El nombre de usuario y la contraseña ahora pueden ser especificados como
parte del DSN PDO para los controladores mysql, mssql, sybase, dblib, firebird
y oci. Anteriormente, esto solo era soportado para el controlador pgsql.
Si un nombre de usuario/contraseña es definido tanto en el
constructor como en el DSN, el constructor tiene precedencia.

Ahora es posible escapar los signos de interrogación en las consultas SQL para evitar que sean interpretados como parámetro ficticio.
Escribir ?? permite enviar un solo signo de interrogación
a la base de datos y, por ejemplo, utilizar el operador PostgreSQL JSON
para saber si una clave existe (?).

### PDO_OCI

[PDOStatement::getColumnMeta()](#pdostatement.getcolumnmeta) ahora está disponible.

### PDO_SQLite

PDOStatement::getAttribute(PDO::SQLITE_ATTR_READONLY_STATEMENT)
permite verificar si la declaración es de solo lectura, es decir, si no
modifica la base de datos.

PDO::setAttribute(PDO::SQLITE_ATTR_EXTENDED_RESULT_CODES, true)
activa el uso de códigos de resultados extendidos en
[PDO::errorInfo()](#pdo.errorinfo) y
[PDOStatement::errorInfo()](#pdostatement.errorinfo).

### SQLite3

Se ha añadido **SQLite3::lastExtendedErrorCode()**
para recuperar el último código extendido del resultado.

Se ha añadido SQLite3::enableExtendedResultCodes($enable = true),
que hará que [SQLite3::lastErrorCode()](#sqlite3.lasterrorcode) devuelva códigos de resultados extendidos.

### Estándar

#### strip_tags() con un array de nombres de tag

    [strip_tags()](#function.strip-tags) ahora acepta un [array](#language.types.array) de tags
    permitidos: en lugar de
    strip_tags($str, '&lt;a&gt;&lt;p&gt;') ahora es posible escribir strip_tags($str, ['a', 'p']).

#### Serialización personalizada de objetos

    Se ha añadido un nuevo mecanismo de serialización personalizada de objetos,
    que utiliza dos nuevas métodos mágicos:
    __serialize y __unserialize.





&lt;?php
// Devuelve un array que contiene todo el estado necesario del objeto.
public function \_\_serialize(): array
{
}

// Restaura el estado de un objeto desde el array de datos proporcionado.
public function \_\_unserialize(array $data): void
{
}
?&gt;

    El nuevo mecanismo de serialización sucederá a la interfaz
    [Serializable](#class.serializable), que será obsoleto en el futuro.

#### Las funciones array merge sin argumentos

    [array_merge()](#function.array-merge) y [array_merge_recursive()](#function.array-merge-recursive)
    ahora pueden ser llamadas sin argumentos, en cuyo caso
    devolverán un [array](#language.types.array) vacío. Esto es útil en conjunción con el operador
    de descomposición, por ejemplo array_merge(...$arrays).

#### La función [proc_open()](#function.proc-open)

    [proc_open()](#function.proc-open) ahora acepta un [array](#language.types.array) en lugar de una
    [string](#language.types.string) para la comanda. En este caso, el proceso se abre directamente
    (sin pasar a través de un shell) y PHP se encargará de escapar los argumentos
    cuando sea necesario.





&lt;?php
proc_open(['php', '-r', 'echo "Hello World\n";'], $descriptors, $pipes);
?&gt;

    [proc_open()](#function.proc-open) ahora soporta los descriptores
    redirect y null.





&lt;?php
// Como 2&gt;&amp;1 en el shell
proc_open($cmd, [1 =&gt; ['pipe', 'w'], 2 =&gt; ['redirect', 1]], $pipes);
// Como 2&gt;/dev/null o 2&gt;nul en el shell
proc_open($cmd, [1 =&gt; ['pipe', 'w'], 2 =&gt; ['null']], $pipes);
?&gt;

#### argon2i(d) sin libargon

    [password_hash()](#function.password-hash) ahora tiene las implementaciones de
    argon2i y argon2id de la extensión sodium cuando PHP es compilado sin libargon.
